Articles.Content:
Who watched it so far?

I think its a rather great movie, though some areas and the ending could be worked on a little.

But still, Arendelle needs a space program.
just watched it, i love it! pixar movies get better and better, also the songs are very catchy
Haven't seen it, but seen a very large number of new disney princess gifs with ice around recently...

This movie caught me completely off guard. The only trailer I'd seen of it was that goofy skit with Olaf and Sven that wasn't even a part of the movie. I saw it thinking the whole thing would be like that only to discover its the most true-to-form Disney musical since Beauty and the Beast. It was an excellent surprise.

just watched it, i love it! pixar movies get better and better, also the songs are very catchy

It's not by Pixar. It's made by Disney animation studios. Pixar's been doing things like Brave and Monsters U these days.

It's not by Pixar. It's made by Disney animation studios. Pixar's been doing things like Brave and Monsters U these days.
I'm pretty sure there's no difference since Disney bought Pixar years ago.
There's absolutely a difference. Pixar was purchased by Disney but remains an entity unto itself distinct from Disney Animation Studios

Same management. Billionaires tend to be adamant supporters of property rights. If they buy your business, they may tell the press you're independent, but if they tell you to do something you do it. All 148 of Murdoch's "independent" editors supported the 2003 invasion of Iraq, for instance. That culture of obedience goes hand-in-hand with economic planning whether its state corporations or public corporations, as well as the hideous errors caused by the knowledge problem of planned economics. "Cars" compares rather well to Homer Simpsons car, the Trabant.

Edited February 2, 2014 by fireflower
Technically the Ukrainian famine was intentionally caused by Stalin because he was a ****ing psychhopath.

It is true that them being under Disney's wing means they don't have the same degree of independence as they enjoyed previously. But that's aside from the point I was originally making, which is that Pixar wasn't involved in Frozen.

Reviving this thread, I watched it as soon as it was out for Dvd and really liked it.

It's an interesting story, a girl with ice powers...

All the new autonomously generated particle physics and clothing physics in this movie are fantastic! There is this scene where Anna is doing a show tune and dancing around and almost all of it her dress was moving naturally via new clothing collision algorithm, and you can just feel the animators made the scene just to show off their new algorithms, just like in the last movie where they were like Ã¢â‚¬Å“LOOK WHAT WE CAN DO WITH HAIR NOW!!!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Anyways its a fine film.

It's funny how everyone's talking about the content of the movie, and you comment on the programming involved....

Let it go, let it g--AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHGHHHHRAGHAAAAUGHLUGH

*violently pukes*

GET IT OUT OF MY HEAD, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, HELP ME! AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!

It's funny how everyone's talking about the content of the movie, and you comment on the programming involved....

I watched these before I watched Frozen.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2RpZRL-Vt_Mhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2RpZRL-Vt_M

Now how many hours do they need to render a single frame? AFAIK in Transformers 3 in the giant snake thingy scene they took about 205 hours! per frame
There. All your problems solved. You are now commanded by music. Let go of life!

Now how many hours do they need to render a single frame? AFAIK in Transformers 3 in the giant snake thingy scene they took about 205 hours! per frame

I don't know but you have got to appropriate the time and computing power both human and machine that went into making a move like frozen.

There is this scene where Anna is doing a show tune and dancing around and almost all of it her dress was moving naturally via new clothing collision algorithm, and you can just feel the animators made the scene just to show off their new algorithms, just like in the last movie where they were like Ã¢â‚¬Å“LOOK WHAT WE CAN DO WITH HAIR NOW!!!Ã¢â‚¬Â

I was thinking the same thing about the snow and ice. The wisps of snow flying around probably took particle effects to a new level. And the ice... refraction-ocalypse.

Hey everyone buy the blu-ray if you want to find out more about the Making of Frozen... no actually they just spite in your face.

Oh this was the video I was originally looking for:

See they had to make a whole engine for just generating the snow!
